page.title: 08Farming_Morcombelake area.
page.content: There are some 20 farms in the area many of them around 100 acres in size. One exception to this size factor is the farming complex centred around Chideock Manor which is run on a partnership basis and covers 1100 acres. A third of thre farms are owned by working farmers while the remainder are tennant farmers. Many are family farms employing few permanent employees outside the immediate family. Extra help is hired at certain times of the year and some work is put out to contract. It is predominantly a dairy farming area with sheep in addition and a few farmers also keep pigs.
